description: Constructing functional prototypes is an intrinsic part of the mechanical design process. This hands-on course covers the fundamentals of layout, measurement, part generation, milling, turning, and computer-controlled machining. By immersion in the department's manufacturing environment, students will gain an intuitive understanding of the techniques and skills necessary to successfully prototype a wide variety of mechanical systems. Enrollment is limited.
name: FUND OF MECH PROTYP
